description: Architected a multi-entity data privacy program, integrating a third-party SaaS platform with custom metadata retrieval systems to automate privacy operations. I currently lead the enterprise data mapping and risk scanning initiatives to identify and mitigate privacy vulnerabilities across the utility's data lake. Additionally, I chair an interdisciplinary working group focused on fraud risk management, where we design AI-enabled process enhancements to strengthen security and operational resilience.

Managed a core calculation engine used by global utilities for billing and scenario modeling. I directed the technical migration of this engine to a cloud-based customer care system, which improved system scalability and data accuracy for household-level utility reporting.

Managed the strategic planning and budget for a multi-year modernization of the firm's account approvals platform. I directed the rollout of a new document review workflow that ensured firm-wide compliance with tight regulatory deadlines and authored the backend requirements for unifying client data architecture.

Conducted quantitative policy and market analyses to support sustainable energy initiatives in the Northeast. I developed data models and Python scripts to optimize analytical outcomes for regulatory proceedings and co-authored case studies used to influence state-level energy policy.

Analyzed state and federal policy shifts regarding residential solar tariff structures. I published a case study on the scalability of New York's full-value tariff model and evaluated 38 corporate applicants for the Zayed Future Energy Prize using ESG and financial performance metrics.

Co-founded a biofuels startup, leading negotiations with investors and engineering firms to establish initial operations. I assessed regional trade policies to identify market entry opportunities in the Caribbean and secured non-binding purchase commitments from off-takers through technical briefings.
